title: Sous Vide Egg and Mashed Potato Breakfast Jars Recipe
full_text:
Sous Vide Egg and Mashed Potato Breakfast Jars Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
10 mins
Cook
60 mins
Active
15 mins
Resting Time
10 mins
Total
80 mins
Serves
4 servings
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
2
cups
(
400
g
;
14
ounces
) leftover
mashed potatoes
,
see notes
Kosher salt
and freshly ground black pepper
4
large
eggs
Coarse sea salt
, such as
fleur de sel or Maldon
, for serving (optional)
Finely sliced chives
, for serving
Toasted bread
, for serving
Directions
Set up a sous vide immersion circulator and bring water bath to 145°F (63°C).
Check consistency of leftover mashed potatoes; if they seem too stiff, adjust with a splash of milk or cream. Taste potatoes and adjust seasoning as needed with salt and pepper. Divide potatoes evenly among four 8-ounce wide mouth Mason jars, gently pressing and smoothing out potatoes into an even layer.
Crack an egg into each jar, then seal jars until just finger-tight (if lids are screwed on too tightly, the jars may crack during cooking). Gently lower jars into water bath until fully submerged, and cook until egg whites are very soft and jammy,  about 1 hour. The internal temperature of egg white should be 145ºF (63ºC).
Transfer jars to counter. Let rest, covered, for 10 minutes to allow the egg whites to slightly set, but not firm. Unscrew lids, taking care not to let any residual water leak into the jars when opening. Season eggs with sea salt (if using) and pepper, and sprinkle with chives. Serve immediately with toasted bread for dipping.
Special equipment
Immersion circulator
, 8-ounce widemouthed Mason jars
Notes
Both our
ultra-fluffy
and
rich and creamy
mashed potatoes will work for this recipe.
If you also have leftover gravy on-hand from a holiday meal, you can up the savory richness of this dish by spooning one tablespoon of gravy into each jar before adding the mashed potatoes in step 2.
Make-Ahead and Storage
The potato-egg jars are best enjoyed immediately, but they can be cooked in advance and refrigerated for up to 3 days. Reheat jars in a sous vide water bath set to 140°F (60°C) until heated through, 30 minutes.
